description: A suburban backyard barbecue is disrupted by the presence of a large Polaris missile embedded in the ground. The scene depicts a man addressing a woman while standing by the grill, seemingly downplaying the dramatic arrival of the missile. The juxtaposition of a nuclear weapon landing in a mundane setting highlights the absurd and surreal nature of the situation. The casual reaction of the couple and a dog sniffing the missile further emphasizes the dark humor and irony. This creates a sense of unsettling normalcy in the face of an extraordinary and dangerous event.
caption: "Let's not overreact, Agnes. ... For one thing, it was only a dud."
